Placeholder text should remain when the user clicks into the text input and gets a cursor. Once the user starts typing the hint text is replaced with the user input text.
Help text appears below the label when the input is active. Help text remains visible while the input is focused and disappears after focus away.
Error messages appear below the input field and are always present while invalid.
Disabled state appears at 50% opacity and has a
Form headings and labels should be set in sentence case with the first letter of the first word capitalized. Please refer to the
pages for specific typography details on each component.
Forms are made up of several different components. The order in which these elements are arranged is flexible, but should always follow the spacing guidelines below.
Forms can be one column or two. The width of each column varies based on the content and layout of the design. On mobile, forms can only have one column.
